data.event: Washington Irving Griffin settled along a freight trail in an area known as Paradise Flats in 1877.
In 1888, Plainville filed for incorporation with 500 residents.

event.title: established an east-west route through Plainville in August of 1888

data.event: Union Pacific Railroad established an east-west route through Plainville in August of 1888.
The original mill was destroyed by fire in 1899 and soon replaced by a larger mill.

event.title: won a gold medal at the 1904

data.event: The flour produced by the mill was of such fine quality, the company won a gold medal at the 1904 Worldâ€™s Fair.
The mill was again destroyed by fire in 1950.
